description.narrative: IOM is strengthening anti-trafficking legal frameworks in Tunisia by supporting the Tunisian governments efforts to enact anti-trafficking legislation and, through the development of a comprehensive anti-trafficking national action plan, working to ensure the laws subsequent implementation. title.narrative: Reinforce Capacity in Tunisia

description.narrative: This project will reinforce capacities of the Government of Tunisia, especially the National Commission against Trafficking in Persons, to better identify and provide adequate care to victims of trafficking. International Organization for Migration (IOM) will achieve this goal by enhancing the capacities of the government to identify, assist, and protect victims of trafficking based on anti-trafficking legislation, through a national training program on protection and assistance to victims of trafficking. Another project goal is improving the implementation of formal procedures to screen and identify trafficking victims among vulnerable groups. This will be achieved through workshops for government and civil society officials, as well as for Embassies and Consular representatives based in Tunisia, especially from sub-Saharan countries. Finally, IOM aims to increase access to adequate protection services for victims of trafficking by providing material support (donations, refurbishment, and equipment support) to the Ministry of Social Affairs shelters for vulnerable populations. This will be achieved through direct assistance services (case management services and access to shelter, medical, and psychosocial services, legal support services, transport, and reintegration) for victims of trafficking, including national and international cases as needs arise.

title.narrative: Supporting the Enactment of Anti-Trafficking Legislation and National Action Plan in Tunisia, as well as Strengthening the National Capacities on Identification and Assistance to VoTs

description.narrative: IOM is strengthening anti-trafficking legal frameworks in Tunisia by supporting the Tunisian governments efforts to enact anti-trafficking legislation and, through the development of a comprehensive anti-trafficking national action plan, working to ensure the laws subsequent implementation. IOM is strengthening governmental and non-governmental capacities to counter all forms of trafficking as well as to identify and adequately protect victims; raising awareness of trafficking through audio/visual materials and national campaigns; and providing direct assistance to victims.
